direction.raw_text: We see three faces in lamplight, looking down. They have been through a long vigil and it shows in their tired eyes and disarranged clothing. One is a young gentlewoman with a sweet girlish face, KATE KELLER; the second is an elderly
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stethoscope at neck, thermometer in fingers; the third is a gruff gentleman in his forties with chin whis- kers, CAPTAIN ARTHUR KELLER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shet11 live.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: closes her eyes. I can tell you now, I thought she wouldn't,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've brought up two of them, but this is my wife's first, she isn't battle-scarred yet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doctor. Will my girl be all right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, by morning she'll be knocking down Captain Kellerfs fences again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is there nothing we should do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Put up stronger fencing, ha?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just let her get well, she knows how to do it better than we do. These things come and go in infants, never know why. Call it acute congestion of the stomach and brain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ? moves after the DOCTOR, we hear them off-camera; we see only KATE'S face hovering over us, her hand adjust- ing the blanket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll see you to your buggy, Doctor. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED DOCTOR (OFF CAMERA) 0 Main thing is the fever's gone. I've never seen a baby, more vitality, that's the truth -- Their voices and footsteps fade. KATE is bent lovingly over the crib, which emits a bleat; her finger is play- ful with the baby's face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hush. Don't you cry now, you've been trouble enough. Call it acute congestion, indeed, I don't see what's so cute about a con- gestion, just because it's yours? We'll have your father run an editorial in his paper, the wonders of modern medicine, they don't know what they're curing even when they cure it. Men, men and their battle scars, we women will have to -- Helen, Helen Captain, Captain, will you come. (She screams)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT. EXT. SIDE OF KELLER HOUSE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: standing lamp in hand watching the doctor's buggy recede in the night. Suddenly from the house behind him comes a knifing scream. KELLER wheels, the scream comes again and the CAMERA follows KELLER's run with the lamp across the yard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT. INT. KELLER HOUSE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: runs into the house and up the dark stairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT. INT. HELEN'S NURSERY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: bursts into the bedroom where KATE is screaming at the crib, her look intent on the baby and terrible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Katie, what's wrong?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look. (CONTINUED) 3 c o.w- u UED She makes a pass with her hand in the crib, at the baby's eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Cont'd) She can't see. Look at her eyes. She takes the lamp from him, moves it before the child's face. She can't seel
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Helen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Or hear. When I screamed she didn't blink. Not an eyelash -- KELLER Helen. Heleni
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She can't hear youl
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His face has something like fury in it, crying the child's name; KATE almost fainting presses her knuckles to her mouth, to stop her own cry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. INT. KELLEL HOUSE - TITLE SHOT. The stairs in the Keller House. In the foreground we see the bannisters, in the background the wall. A shadow.of the erratic, staggering figure of 5 year old HELEN appears on the wall, moving slowly. The two Negro children scamper past -- their excited laughter coming to us, in contrast to the mute HELEN. In CU, in the FG, HELEN'S little hands come into the frame, grasping the bannister rail.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. EXT. YARD - TITLE SHOT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: lookin`, down on lines of bed sheets hung up in the Keller yard to dry. It appears to be a kind of (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED maze, the sheets blowing in the wind; and staggering among them is the figure of the child, HELEN 5 years old, reach- ing out, struggling, buffeted by the damp, blowing sheets,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: DOWN towards the figure. HELEN lashes out, her face frightened, unknowing --- she pulls down a sheet, be- comes tangled in its folds, almost hysterical. In the BG KATE comes rushing from the house -- to help her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT. INT. LIVING ROOM KELLER HOUSE - TITLE SHOT. There is a Christmas tree with decorations and in a WIDE SHOT we see HELEN, 7 years old, reaching up into tree. At a window we see the faces of Percy 8 years, and Martha, 7 years, looking in. HELENrS hand gets a Christmas ball and rips it down, shattering at her feet. CRAB IN AND AROUND coming to the side of the tree, seeing HELENtS hands, another ball, she pulls it down. We see her face, blurred out, through the pine branches and needles, and beyond her the other children watching. $. DAY. EXT. AFIELD - TITLE SHOT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: HIGH SHOT. We see the lonely expanse of field with 0 a low grass sprouting up, in the BG is the Keller house perhaps. Going slowly across the field is the figure of the child HELEN, Patty Duke. From in under CAMERA comes
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: following her. (CONTINUE SCRIPT)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . OMIT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. EXT. BACKYARD KELLER HOUSE AND PUMP - TITLE SHOT. Scene will be out MOS up until RINGING OF BELL: Now we are in leaf-dappled sunlight in the Keller yard, on three kneeling children and an old dog around the pump.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: with jug on way to barn to get milk. The dog is a setter named BELLE, and she is sleeping. Two of the children are Negroes, MARTHA and PERCY. The third child is HELEN, quite unkempt, in body a vivacious little person with a fine head, attractive, but noticeably blind, one eye larger and protruding; her gestures are abrupt, insistent, lacking in human restraint, and her face never
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED smiles. She is flanked by the other two, in a litter of 0 paper-doll cutouts, and while they speak, HELEN'S hands thrust at their faces in turn, feeling baffledly at the movements of their lips. The CAMERA is on this; the dialogue is only background.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: First Itm gonna cut off this doe- torts leg, one, two, now then -- PERCY Why you cuttin' off that doctor's legs?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm gonna give him a operation. Now I'm gonna cut off his arms, one, two. Now I'm gonna fix up She pushes HELEN'S hand away from her mouth. You stop that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cut off his stomach, that's a good operation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I'm gonna cut off his head first, he got a bad cold.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ain't gonna be much of that doc- tor left to fix up, time you finish all them opera-- But HELEN is poking her fingers inside his mouth, to feel his tongue; he bites at them, annoyed, and she jerks them away. HELEN now fingers her own lips, moving them in imitation, but soundlessly. Again the CAMERA on this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What you do, bite hand?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's how I do, she keep pokint. her fingers in my mouth, I just bite 'em off. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is scowling, the lips under her fingertips moving in silence, growing more and more frantic, until in a bizarre rage she bites at her own fingers. This sends PERCY off into laughter, but alarms :MARTHA.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, you stop now. She pulls EELEI' S hand down, You just sit quiet and But at once HELEIT topples LTARTHA on her back, knees pinning her shoulders down, and ;-ravs the sissors.

direction.raw_text: (No break) As long as there's the least chance. For her to see. Or hear, or -- KELLER There isntt. Now I must finish here.

direction.raw_text: I think, with your permission, Captain, I'd like to write to the Perkins School.

direction.raw_text: I said no, Katie.

result.ToD: HELEN NOW IS GROPING AMONG THING
result.heading: HELEN NOW IS GROPING AMONG THING
S DESK, AND PAWS HIS PAPERS TO THE FLOOR

direction.raw_text: . HELEN NOW IS GROPING AMONG THING.' ON FELL ER t S DESK, AND PAWS HIS PAPERS TO THE FLOOR. KJ MLIM IS EXASPERATED.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Katie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: quickly turns HELEN away, and retrives the papers. I might as well tAy to work in a henyard as in th.s house -- (CONTINUED) 9
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . C ONTINU.D
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You really ought to put her away, Father.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Staring up) What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some asylum. It's the kindest thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why, she's your sister, James, not a nobody -- JAMES Half sister, and half-mentally defective, she can't even keep herself clean. It's not pleasant to see her about all the time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you dare? Complain of what 0 you can see?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Very annoyed) This discussion is at an end]
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: gropes her way with the doll back to AUNT EV. The house is at sixes and sevens from morning 'til night over the childl I want some peace here, I don't care how, but one way we won't have it is by rushing up and down the country every time someone hears of a new quack. I'm as sensible to this affliction as -- 14. HELEN WITH AUNT EV fingering her dress, yanks two buttons from it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Helena My buttons. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED HELEN pushes the buttons into the doll's face. KATE 0 now sees, comes swiftly to kneel, lifts HELEN'S hand to her own eyes in question.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eyes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: nods energetically. She wants the doll to have eyes. Another kind of silence now, while KATE takes pins and buttons from the sewing basket and attaches them to the doll as eyes. KELLER stands, caught, and watches morosely, AUNT EV blinks and conceals her emotion by inspecting her dress.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My goodness me, I'm not decent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She doesn't know better, Aunt Ev. I'll sew them on again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 40 It's worth a couple of buttons, Kate, look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: now has the doll with eyes, and cannot contain herself for joy; she rocks the doll, pats it vigorously, kisses it. This child has more sense than all these men Kellers, if there's ever any way to reach that mind of hers.
direction.name: direction

result.ToD: HELEN SUDDENLY SCRAMBLES TOWARD THE CRADLE, AND UN- HESITATINGLY OVERTURNS IT
result.heading: HELEN SUDDENLY SCRAMBLES TOWARD THE CRADLE, AND UN- HESITATINGLY OVERTURNS IT

direction.raw_text: . HELEN SUDDENLY SCRAMBLES TOWARD THE CRADLE, AND UN- HESITATINGLY OVERTURNS IT. The swaddled baby tumbles out and CAPTAIN KELLER barely manages to dive and catch it in time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Helen! All are in commotion, the baby screams, but HELEN un- perturbed is lying her doll in its place, KATE on her (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED knees, pulls her hands off the cradle, wringing them;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is bewildered.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Helen, Helen, you're not to do such things, how can I make you
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Hoarsely, handing the baby to AUNT EV) Katie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How can I get it into your head, my darling, my poor -- KELLER Katie, some way of teaching her an iota of discipline has to be
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How can you discipline an afflicted child? Is it her fault?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: fingers have fluttered to her Mother's lips, vainly trying to comprehend their movements; we are close on these two.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't say it was her fault.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then whose? I don't know what to dot How can I teach her, beat her
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: until she's black and blue?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not safe to let her run around loose. Now there must be a way of confining her, somehow, so she can't---
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where, in a cage? She's a growing child, she has to use her limbs!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Answer me one thing, is it fair to Mildred here? (CONTINUIM)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED S KATE (INEXORABLY) Are you willing to put her away? Now HELEN'S face darkens in the same rage as at herself earlier, and her hand strikes at KATE'S lips. KATE catches her again, and HELEN begins to kick, struggle, twist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She wants to talk, like -- be like you and me. She holds HELEN struggling until we HEAR from the child her first sound so far, an inarticulate weird noise in her throat such as an animal in a trap might make; and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: releases her. The second she is free, HELEN blunders away collides violently with a chair, falls, and sits weeping. KATE comes to her, embraces, caresses, soothes her, and buries her own face in her hair, until she can control her voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Every day she slips further away. I don't know how to call her back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, I've a mind to write to Boston myself. If that School can't help her, maybe they'll know somebody who can.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Presently, heavily) I'll write to Perkins, Katie. He stands with the baby in his clasp, staring at HELEN'S head, hanging down on KATE'S arm.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: EXT.
location: SHOOTING UP INTO VESTIBULE OF TRAIN

direction.raw_text: . DAY. EXT. BOSTON STATION - SHOOTING UP INTO VESTIBULE OF TRAIN. M.R. ANAGNOS on platform with ANNIE'S suitcase, is reach- ing up to help ANNIE mount steps. CAMERA is behind
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . C 013TINUM ANAGNOS 0 -- only that a suitable governess has been found here and will come. It will no doubt be difficult for you there, Annie, but it has been difficult for you at our school too, hmmm?
direction.name: direction

result.heading: SEE ANNIE AND ANAGNOS FROM REAR

direction.raw_text: . CAMERA IN VESTIBULE - SEE ANNIE AND ANAGNOS FROM REAR.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...-This is my last time to counsel you, Annie, and you do lack some -- by some I mean all -- what, tact, or talent to bencT. To others. And what has saved you on one or more occasions at Perkins is that there was nowhere to expel you to. Above ANNIEIS seat ANAGNOS puts her suitcase, looking .down at her. Your eyes hurt?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CU ANNIE - WEARING SMOKED GLASSES.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My ears, Mr. Anagnos.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nowhere but back to that dreadful place where children learn to be saucy. Annie, I know how unhappy it was there, but that battle is dead and done with. Why not let it stay buried?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think God must owe me a resur- rection.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (A bit shocked) What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ANNIE TAPS HER BROW.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, he keeps digging up that battle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That is not a proper thing to say. Annie, be humble. He extends a gift to her.. You'll need their affection, work- ing with this child.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: not quite comprehending, looks at gift. A gift with our affection.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: opens a small box and sees a garnet ring. She looks up, blinking, then down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dear Mr. Anagnos, (Her voice is trembling)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But she swallows over getting the ring on her finger and cannot continue until she finds a woebegone joke.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, what should I say -- I'm an ignorant, opinionated girl and everything I am I owe to you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That is only half true, Annie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Which half? The train lurches. ANAGNOS bends and kisses her on the cheek and says,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Goodbye. Goodbye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (She calls after him
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ) I won't give them any trouble. I'll be so ladylike they won't notice I've come. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED 0 Passengers behind ANNIE turn reacting to her shout. She is conscious of this and sinks down'in seat. Past ANNIE, through window of train, we see ANAGNOS join 5 or 6 blind girls on the platform, and the train departs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jimmie.
